subject: Issue with shop RSS Coremetrics tracking tags
description:
Hi, 

Some of the London 2012 shop widgets throughout London2012.com are dropping the Coremetrics tracking tag off the end. For example, please see the widgets in the links below:

http://www.london2012.com/paralympic-archery
http://www.london2012.com/athletics
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/

A widget that is tagged and working correctly can be found here: http://www.london2012.com/archery

e-Commera have checked the RSS feed and it appears to be working fine with tracking automatically being appended.

Please could you look into why this may be happening?

Thanks
Claire

Is it possible to ask Ecommera to ensure that the links to the product pages are identical, in all of the feeds?

Hi Danny,

I hope you’re well and had a nice weekend?

Just wondered if you had an update on the RSS Coremetrics tracking tags?

Hello, 

Just wondering if you have a rough date for when you think this might be resolved, or how long this may take? 

I'm just being chased by the Shop guys.

Hi Claire,
I have had a detailed look at this.
Can I ask: do you know when the coremetrics were added?
The issue is that the product link that ecommera supplies us with (e.g. http://shop.london2012.com/London-2012-pictogram-Boxing-pin-badge/30007910,default,pd.html?cm_mmc%3dLOCOG-_-RSS-_-olympic-boxing-_-30007910) changes across the rss feeds depending on which list the product appears in.
It's unclear to me whether this was ever communicated between ecommera, yourselves, and us.
I propose that we amend our feed parser, and the frontend code (the php on the live site) in order to add the ability to store a selection of links for each product - one per list it appears in. I anticipate that it will take one day (including testing/deployment). We should be able to get it done this week - if it is authorized promptly.
Kind regards,
Kieran

Thanks Kiernan.

I understand the Coremetrics tags were added quite a significant amount of time ago.

Is there anything else you need from us or eCommera to go ahead with this fix?

Thanks
Claire

No, I just need your goahead.
Kieran

Great – thanks.

Yep – all good to go ahead. Do let me know if there’s anything you need.

Thanks
Claire
Marking as authorized. cc Tom.

subject: Paralympic Torch Relay
description:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>
Date: 22 July 2011 14:09

Now that the Olympic Torch Relay nominations process is in full swing
we need to turn our attention to the Paralympic Torch Relay. In fact
we need to launch a PTR site not dissimilar to the OTR site on 15
September.

This is obviously a very tight timeline, so the plan is to repurpose
the templates we created for the OTR site, essentially tweaking them
to use the PTR ‘look’ (read brand). I’m working on a brief that I will
share with you next week once we have something from, so this is
basically a heads-up of work to come!

Ed, I’d like Cogapp to work on the wireframes and designs and create
the HTML for Kitsite to implement, pretty much the same as we did for
the OTR site. Given the speed with which we’ll need to do this we may
even have to skip the wireframes step.

Any questions, give me a shout. Else I’ll be in touch next week.

Cheers,

Andy

Debs, you asked the innocent question of whether or not you could have the page back after you published and expired it, so you could re-publish it at the correct time. This is usually very straight-forward but for news and blog pages it isn't, because the workflow is non-standard (see http://postcms.zendesk.com/entries/20480623-removing-news-and-blogs-from-the-site).

We were eventually able to put it back into a 'Draft' state, which meant that it wasn't being linked to from the front page, but to do this we had to bypass the usual workflows, so that the page was not actually deleted form the site.

Jamie has I think already looked at google analytics and it would appear that the page was accessed a few times in the late-afternoon. This is likely to have been when the page was inadvertently not just published on the site but linked to from other parts of the site.

Once we removed these links after around 6pm, the traffic appears to have died down from a handful of visits to nothing and even though the page was still on the site and theoretically visible, it was not being accessed, because there was no way to navigate to it from any other part of the site.

The moral of the tale is probably that if an embargoed news story (or blog entry) is mistakenly published and then expired, it is a mistake to attempt to recover it by bypassing the usual workflows. Instead, it is almost certainly easier to just create a new version of the page and re-enter the copy.

thanks Danny. I'm not sure if the traffic to the page died down because of the links, or because we did expire the page again at around 7pm. Either way, as you say, a lesson duly learned for next time!

Deb

Hi Liz,

That's pretty much it, 

Getty FTP a XML file and an associated JPG to a FTP server, we then check that server hourly for XML files and if we find one we extract the metadata from the XML file (for the name/tags etc) and retrieve the JPG (which is referenced in a roundabout way in the XML file). 

Once we have the file we delete the XML file, the JPG and any enclosing folder (if the XML/JPG we just removed we're the last files in it)

* I say "roundabout way" as the path to the JPG is local to the XML file ie. you need to work out which folder the XML is in to find which folder the JPG file will be in. The filename in the XML also doesn't take into account of the edge cases where the file is sent more than once (see below for details). Lastly the jpg files have a .jpg extension where as the XML reefers to a .JPG file.

Is this for DeltaTre? Happy to let them have a login to the FTP server as long as they promise not to delete any images. I assume come games time you'll have your own FTP server setup for this, but for now it may be useful to see a live stream (rather than test data - as the test data obviously didn't show any of the *real* day-to-day edge cases!!!). 

Jamie

ps. cc'ing you in on this ticket so that you can see the stuff below in-line

On 26 Sep 2011, at 15:31, Liz Goulding wrote:

--

1) Top level / date folders

When an image is sent form Getty Media Manager to the the FTP server (btw this is a KS managed server) a date stamped folder is created with the following format  /2011-006-15T11_04_24Z/

subject: New homepage
current_collaborators: Danny Sofer, ITS Operations, Tom Price Stephens
description:
Hi

We've just recieved a new design for the homepage - I've attached the psd.

If you could implement the changes that would be great - let me know if you need any additional assets or information, and when it's ready to be tested.

Thanks

comments.value:
Hi

We've just recieved a new design for the homepage - I've attached the psd.

If you could implement the changes that would be great - let me know if you need any additional assets or information, and when it's ready to be tested.

Thanks

Sorry we actually have a few changes to this. Please do make these changes:
1. Adding the social media buttons at the top of the page
2. Split out web cam and videos into two seperate units
3. Move the map onto the second row

And don't:
1. Change the current numbered buttons for mini thumbnails - these should stay as numbers
2. Change the clock section on the left

If you could give me a call to confirm this makes sense and when you can do the work, that would be great, thanks. My number is 02032012781

Fiona

Hi Fiona,

We probably wont get to start on this till next week, I'll give you a call once we're ready to start to clarify we understand what needs changing.

Jamie
Hi Jamie - just wondering how this is coming along?
Hi Fiona, we are not ignoring this one--just clearing our backlog. Have you got a deadline for it?

Hi again,

Just wondered how this and the news pages are coming along and if we can have an estimate of when they might be complete.

Andy also has a new requirement for the homepage:
"Could you please include the creation of a simple dropdown widget that will allow users to navigate directly to each Olympic and Paralympic sports pages. Most importantly, this needs to be built in such a way that search bots see the dropdown menu items as links as the main driver for doing this is to improve our search rankings for sports related phrases. This can be achieved via clever CSS so shouldn’t be a problem for any front end developer worth their salt."

Does that make sense? Any ideas where it might be best to add them to the page?

Fiona, our schedule has been somewhat thrown by ongoing changes to Torch Relay (don't ask about the Viral app!), but I think that has all calmed down now and we are hoping to get this work out the door by the end of next week. Sorry for the delay.

I am going to separate out the changes to News navigation into a separate ticket, so we can track it more easily.

Hi Fiona,

We're almost there on the homepage,

But can I double check what components you wanted in the far left, on my notes I have the 'days to go' counter then on the next line (alogn with 3 static promos) we have the map and a search box. But on the actual PSD we have tickets / facebook / map.

thanks

Jamie

Right...

The countdown clock needs to remain where it is - no horizontal bar
The Facebook and Twitter buttons should then go below this - where the Tickets Sign Up promo is currently

Does that make sense?

Thanks
~1.6d so far coding the bar, fiddling with the video player, serperating tabs properly ( non js ), moving the postcode map box around, setting up the share options in the new breadcrumb.....

Looks like this! 

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test/homepage/index.php

Looks like this! 

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test/homepage/index.php

Thanks Lars. A few things

Apologies if I wasn’t clear, but we no longer want the horizontal countdown clock – just the one on the left

Also, where have the 3 image/text boxes next to the map gone? The page definitely doesn’t seem to be displaying correctly for me. Screenshot attached

Hey Fiona,

Thanks for the screenshot. I have now removed the horizontal bar. Regarding the images, they are editable content which can be added via the cms. I've now added some test text and images so it should be looking better now!

Thanks
Lars

Hi Lars,

Looking back at the original design - the video panel on the right also has a browsable list of video thumbnails underneath that are not included here.

The video panel itself is also overlaying the content below in IE for me, and some stray html is appearing in the video description. (Screenshot attached)

Could we also look at reducing the white space between the countdown clock and the FB/Twitter links on the left? This looks slightly unbalanced to me.

Once these changes have been made I think we're pretty close and I'll circulate to the team here

New version is here:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test/homepage/index.php

A few revisions:

Can we:
1. Change the Twitter text to just say Follow Us
2. Include the Facebook text as a link
3. Increase the size of both bits of text
4. Change the YouTube logo to the one attached, which is hopefully a little clearer
I've done all 4 of them but i had to resize the youtube image back to 18px, still think it looks a bit clearer than before.

This is looking great.

Only thing - in the top bar, can we ensure it is one colour all the way across, and that the social media buttons are right-aligned?

Also, the main carousel image isn't rendering properly and so has a black segment on the left.

Once these changes are made, what needs to happen for this to go live? I need to find out how much testing technology will want to do too...

Thanks

Hey Fiona, 

Do you refer to the background color of this ( attached ), it was like this in the designs, are you sure you want me to remove this?
I've aligned them to the right now. The black triangle will disappear once the page is published ( either live or staging ) so i will leave this for now.

Let me know what you think about the breadcrumb thing!
Thanks
Lars
I think it all needs to be the darker grey, for sure. Could you copy Tom into this ticket too please? I can't work out how. Thanks
I've attached the original design i was going after... and includedl tom :)
Fiona/Tom are you happy for this to go live?

Fiona is out of the office at the moment – and she is more on top of this than me so I’ll try and get hold of her.

Did you get her replies around the grey colour behind the youtube twitter & fb logos?

The grey needs to be changed to the single darker grey.

Tom - Russ hasn't seen this yet, do you think you could send it through to him?

Then if he's happy, we'll double-double check that Liz is happy with how it looks and we're go.


________________________________________

I see two issues outstanding:

1) the two-tone grey bar in the breadcrumb nav (#breadcrumb-2012)

2) the black triangle on the left of the promos (.feature-content)
Both of them are sorted!

Feedback from our end:

Main twitter link - can copy read "Follow us on Twitter" so that it's the same style as "Like us of Facebook" above it.

We were expecting a sports drop down menu - to improve our SEO ranking, I've spoken to Fiona who thought it was being worked on?
This was the requirement that there would be a direct link to each of the Olympic and Paralympic sports.

In the main menu at the top - there seems to be a bug for the links on the right hand side.
ie. when you go into 'the games' drop down, the right hand side links all have the link text displayed above them?
2.3 so far

Hey Tom,

I've amended the Twitter copy. Regarding the dropdown, cannot reproduce it here which is strange, can you send me a screenshot over? If this is happeneing, we should probably raise a new ticket for this to be fixed.

Thanks,
Lars

Apologies Lars - I'd missed this reply.

Will email you a screenshot directly now.

Do you know if any work had been done to implement the dropdown for the olympic and paralympic sports?
No problem Tom! I'll ask danny about it!
Tom, we don't know anything about the sports dropdown. I think this is a new requirement. Perhaps we should have a quick chat about it.
Ah, yes. Fiona did mention this one on May 25. We will look at this as soon as we have a bit more information from you about where on the page you want it to sit and what it should look like.

As promised an update on the sports drop down.

Specifically - we didn't have a particular preference as to where it sites, suggested areas were the breadcrumb bar, creating space near the countdown clock/fb&tw buttons, the footer, the main menu bar, or potentially replacing the map promo spot.

Andy did also make the point that they may need to be split into to drop downs due to the number of sports.

The one specific requirement is that they appear as links on the homepage - most dropdowns satisfy this.

If worthwhile, we can have a phone call with andy.

Hey Tom, is there or can we have a design for this? 

OK after the conversation i take it, that this should be similar to the dropdown on the festival site.... , can we check thats true?

Thanks
As just discussed, we are keen to have a design treatment, if this is at all possible.

I can confirm that the map promo is not editable. could you confirm whether you want this changed now (and therefore you will lose the map postcode search) or leave as is for now and change it at a future date?

Also, we are just looking at whether we will need to do a site re-publish to get the Follow links at top right to appear on every page. We will get back to you on this shortly.

It needs to be an editable promo spot – and so yes can we do this now and lose the postcode search,

Thanks,

Tom

Hey Tom, 

I've removed the map and put the original editable spot back.

Lars
Also, I have checked for the breadcrumb and it'll need to be a site republish. I think we should probably make a new include for this though so we can turn them on/off easier....

OK. Tom, we are going to make this an include. Apart from anything else, I would not be surprised if you will want to add a G+1 link, which it would make sense to be able to do without more than one site republish.

I have mentioned this to Finn who will look into whether we want to add a G+1 button, 

Will raise the ticket with technology around a site republish. (Russ is away for two weeks at the moment so won't have seen these messages)

I expect it will be at a week or two before we can find a slot - after the republish for SEO optimisation do you guys have a clearer estimate for site republish timings?

A second question to feed the answer into finn,

unless I'm wrong G+ buttons work for individual pages, where as the current facebook button links to our facebook profile. 

Would it be a different/larger piece of work to integrate G+ buttons, and would it be better placed alongside future work which may include adding facebook buttons to like individual pages?

Once we have published the follow-links as an include, we can add a G+1  link at a later stage, if required, so we don't have to decide all of this before the re-publish. 

Also, you are correct that G+1 is for individual pages and is much more like facebook's "like" icon, but the code is the same on all pages, so there is no need to customize the link for each page--if you decide you do want to add it at a later date.

Its an include now. To put this live we will still need a site wide republish and i will need to add it to every tempate ~ but once that is done we can change them really easy without republishing the whole site!
I have created a new ticket for the Follow links: #4555
The include is now in all the master template ( so its publishing out from now on ). Once we get the ok, we can switch it live.
Lars, moved Follow links to #4555 (otherwise we will never get this ticket closed).

So I think this is waiting for comment from me, attached is an image with some circled text.

It seems our homepage has a variety of font colours, and our brand rules are that any link text underneath 14pt should be #007bcc - thus, all of our homepage text links should be this colour.

And in an opposite colour switch, the 'Go' buttons are the darker blue when they should be #1792fd.

Can we ammend this - put the banner ads in place, and then we should be good to go next week.

THanks

It seems our homepage has a variety of font colours, and our brand rules are that any link text underneath 14pt should be #007bcc - thus, all of our homepage text links should be this colour.

~ I couldn't find any links larger than 14pt ( 19px )
~ All links under 14pt ( with exceptions like tabs/ header menues / footer ) are now in #007bcc ( i believe ~ do you have a way of checking }
~ Go buttons fixed 

Where do the banners go? Large one on the top and is there another one?

Cheers
L

Looks great! Thanks Lars,

The large banner will go on top as normal, and the 220x120 will go as it does on the current page. (Replacing the social media promo box)
Ok i'll put that in place then!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ticket summary: 

We should now have exactly the same homepage as what we started with 

~ apart from the somewhat the social breadcrumb was part of this ticket and another 
~ the sport drop-downs on the bottom are new
~ and the webcam / videos split

All the other stuff has been now removed.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ok,

Hopefully will launch this next week.

A few questions...

1. When published it will get the new breadcrumb bar - with social media buttons?
2. When pushed live the sports dropdowns will work? The currently give php errors.
3. When live the page will work with the current ad tags?

Thanks

Hey Tom,

Regarding your questions: 

1. When published it will get the new breadcrumb bar - with social media buttons?
   yes!
2. When pushed live the sports dropdowns will work? The currently give php errors. 
  works for me on staging, did you look at the cms preview? I think it works fine.
3. When live the page will work with the current ad tags?
  i believe so! ( Checking with Jamie )

Lars
Agreed – I’m happy for this to be published ☺

Great,

Have spoken to both Danny and Jamie, and I think we can push this live tomorrow morning?

Thanks,

Tom

Hi Tom

Have been watching this for a while – when is this going live and is there any testing that you and we in technology should do to welcome it in.

Russ
Jamie, assigning to you for pushing live tomorrow.

> HI Jamie,
>

> Many thanks
> Erin

> Hi Jamie,
>  
> Thank you for your comments. If there are issues with the tags, I will need to check them out. Can we therefore hold off publishing the French site until Monday? I just don't want pages up there with no ads over the weekend.
>  
> Thanks
> Erin
>  
> Kind Regards
>  
> Erin Berger
> Telephone:  +44 (0) 203 2012 061
> Mobile:  +44 (0) 791 2999557

> From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com]

> To: Erin Berger
> Cc: Morag Reavley; Tom Price-Stephens

>  
> Hi Erin
>  
> I think the problem here is that those pages got overlooked by the bulk publish (this can happen if something else is holding a lock on them)
>  
> I notice the last published dates on a lot of these pages are prior to September, ie. the 10th August.
>  
> Re. The pgs_games_olympic-park/landing-page I republish that page and the ads are now showing.
> http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-park/index.php
>  
> I've also republished a couple of the French pages and the ad tags are also now appearing there too (although no ads are being pulled though).

> var h='120';
>  
> btw. If the adverts are showing in the CMS there is no real reason why when published they wouldn't appear on the live site.

Hi Tom,

> I’m not sure if there is a zendesk ticket for ad related issues,

There isn't a ticket specifically for ad tags, although do feel free to open a new one (I have just opened a ticket for this issue, in fact this is that very ticket!)

btw. it's probably best to open a new ticket per issue or group of related issues, that way we don't end up with tickets that never get closed.

> http://www.london2012.com/planning/ - Can we please remove tags from this page

Have removed the tags, but I still need to bulk republish that section.

> http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/young-games-makers/have-you-got-what-it-takes-.php
> Seems to have a banner on already, though not nessecarily the correct tag.
> Tag for this section should be: pgs_get-involved_volunteer/young-games-makers. All others in the CMS have this ad tag.

That's the tag the page has already? (view the page source)
var tags='pgs_get-involved_volunteer/young-games-makers'

I have mentioned this already to Erin, but probably worth re-iterating, the tags are *auto-generated* based on the section hierarchy in the CMS.

We have added in some special rules for keys sections ie. news/blogs/photos and the games/venue sections.

But there really is no notion of changing a tag on an individual page (we did do this for a BP/Arts page, but that was meant to be no more than a stop gap until we modified the CMS to allow you to assign/override the tag on a specific page). We can't continue to add 'per page' executions into the code base, we really need to keep it clean and limited to outputting tag from the standard logic or else we'll just end up with problems down the road.

In terms of tags that look wrong, if something looks wildly out then let us know (for example the year folder inside the photos sections meant that the standard logic for generating tags need to be slightly altered for those sections. But in general, the tags that are generated in the CMS should drive the DFP tags, rather than the other way round (as we don't have a config file where we can easily say these page or section get these tags).

Hope that makes sense

Jamie
Section is now republishing.

D3. – D12 Marvellous, thank you!
D12. This was specifically requested by Campbell. Um, maybe he has misremembered... will check
D13-14 Perfect

Thanks so much! There may be further teeny tweaks but hopefully not too many more.

The key outstanding thing now is to run an end-to-end test. I’m trying to c atch Campbell to discuss this as it is quite complicated – we need an email generating with the unique link etc. If we set up some test users in Campbell’s database and generate emails to those users, should the form be ready to test in your view? What URL will the emails need to use?

Morag

PS Has Campbell been in touch this pm? He seems very non-communicative but I hear you’ve had a number of conversations?

I have all I need from Campbell for now.
The last remaining thing is for me to cross-check his DTD against what we have implemented in its absence.
I envisage doing this this evening or first thing tomorrow morning.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

Please can you advise the link to the form we need to put into the email so we can test the process?

Thank you!

Morag

PS – call set up with Campbell at 11am

http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/ca/$HASH
e.g.
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/ca/E97C7E8528A53F260657CD6BE8408124DEF543F8

Perfect – thanks

And then for real it will be without the vip_staging_locog_ bit

Some teeny teeny spots (and apologies if these are still showing because I am not looking at the latest version):

Family Name and Previous Family Name are still title case – please could they be sentence case?

ID number is still mandatory – should be non-mandatory
Background check – please could you tweak the text ‘All Ceremonies participants are required to undergo various security checking’ to read ‘All Ceremonies participants are required to undergo various security checks’
Accessibility tooltip ‘We will be holding prioritised accessible sessions at 13:00hrs on 10 and 12 November, which will be smaller in number and specifically designed.’ Change to ‘We will be holding prioritised accessible sessions at 13:00hrs on 10 and 12 November, which will be smaller in number and specifically designed for auditionees with accessibility requirements.’
Accessibility ‘I will require a Lip Speaker’- please make all sentence case

I just tried submitting the form now without the Ts and Cs box checked. It allowed me to do so (and gave me the ‘Sorry, we could not find your details. Please check that your email client did not truncate the url’ message, which seems wrong). Also, can I check the conditions in which you will receive this message normally – is it if the email address is not in our db? What if the user changes their email address from what they previously registered when populating the form?

Update! The go live for this now will be Tues rather than Monday. Which doesn’t give us that much more time, but hopefully makes it a bit less hectic.

Later today I am hoping we will have the test emails coming through; I’ve asked for an email to be sent to you for testing too!

Thanks for all your work on this – I’m sorry it’s been so arduous. [Would put a smiley here but there is no point....]

Hi Morag,
You're welcome. I'll keep a look out for the email.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

Not all the bugs noted last week seem to have been fixed – e.g. there’s still a star on the id number field.

I’ve had some feedback that ‘previous address’ seems to be mandatory (the tester put in a date of previous residence at this address of 15/08/11 which generated this response).

Also, as discussed last week, the accessibility auditions do not display in IE – see grab below. We were also going to add under ‘Please select your first choice of audition date’ the text about accessible auditions above?

[cid:image003.jpg@01CC71FC.A534A5D0]

Hi Morag,
I'm looking into all of these issues, plus the one which Campbell raised this morning.
Regarding address: Previous address IS mandatory if you have lived at your current address for <3 years.
Being at your current address for 15/08/2011 certainly meets this criteria.
Or have I misunderstood the issue?
Kieran

Address: you are completely right. User was being dense. But so was I not to have picked this up before bothering you.

[Eye-rolling smiley]

Hi Kieran

We are hoping to start sending out the emails later today (at the rate of 1,000 per hour). Just pending a final test email using real user data.

From a form perspective, are you happy we are in a state to go live? I can’t think of anything still pending on our side – do you agree?

Thanks!

I still haven't heard back from Campbell regarding the entries from Monday
morning.
Apart from that, though, I have mainly been responding to tweaks from you,
and comments from the test team, so if you're happy then I'm happy.
Kieran

[Smiley smiley]

I will chase Campbell now. He seems to be a bit in disarray...
Update: we are still waiting for the final test so plan is for us to test tonight and then dispatch tomorrow am.

Hi Kieran

Just to let you know: we've tested and it all seems fine, so we are sending out the emails this morning. Fingers crossed there are no glitches!

The form looks great - thanks so much for your work on this!

Ok. Can you let me know when they start going out please so I can keep an
eye on the load?
Thanks,
Kieran
Will do!

Hi Kieran

An urgent change to form copy please! We need to remove references to accessible auditions, as apparently they are already filled up.... by people who don’t really need them.

In the intro copy in paragraph “You will be given a choice of dates for your audition. Please note we will also be holding 'Prioritised Accessibility' sessions on 10 and 12 November which are smaller sessions designed for those who require support“ please can you remove the whole sentence ‘Please note we will also be holding 'Prioritised Accessibility' sessions on 10 and 12 November which are smaller sessions designed for those who require support’.


In the Accessibility section please can you remove ‘We will be holding accessible auditions’ – replace with the text ‘We will be holding some prioritised accessible sessions. If you have accessibility requirements select ‘yes’ above and select an available audition date below. You will be contacted by a member of staff to schedule and confirm your session.’

In the Auditions section please can you change the same text as in the Accessibility section.

The dropdown doesn’t need you to do anything in terms of removing the auditions since these come from Campbell’s XML.

Could you manage to do this in the next hour or so?

Thank you very much!

Morag

Hi Morag,
This is done now (altho might take a few mins to publish).
Btw, the intro paragraph, you can edit yourself (although I've already done it).
Kieran

Magnificent.

Intro para – sorry, my fault, I knew that. But it’s been a long week.

Thank you and bon weekend!

subject: Events database for London 2012
description:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Services Tenders [ServicesTenders@london2012.com]
<ServicesTenders@london2012.com>
Date: 20 June 2011 17:06
Subject: Events database for London 2012
To:


The London Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympic Games
(LOCOG) requires an online events data management and publishing
service (events platform) to host and serve events listings to a
number of web and mobile applications for London 2012. This tool will
provide a single source for listing public-facing events from now to
the period of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games, including
cultural, community and big screen events. The events platform will be
capable of ingesting data from multiple sources, and outputting data
in industry-standard formats. It will also support access by multiple
users across a range of administration and publication roles.



LOCOG would like to invite you to tender for the provision of the
events database for London 2012



Before you can participate in the  ITT, you are required to:



1)            Complete and return the attached Competefor Template

2)            Sign and return the attached Confidentiality Agreement;

3)            Register your organisation on the LOCOG eTendering site; and

4)            Email this address with confirmation that you have registered.



Confidentiality Agreement

You are requested to return to LOCOG a signed copy of the attached
Confidentiality Agreement.  It will cover all dealings between LOCOG
and your organisation in relation to any proposal for the Games.



Please sign and scan a copy, then e-mail it to
ServicesTenders@london2012.com and return two hard copies for the
attention of Nicola Peers to the following address:

Procurement – LOCOG, 22nd Floor

1 Churchill Place

Canary Wharf

London E14 5LN.



LOCOG’s eTendering site

Bidders are required to register your organisation on the LOCOG
eTendering site. From here you will be able to access the ITT.



The process for registering your organisation on the LOCOG eTendering
site is as follows:

1.             Browse to the LOCOG eTendering site:
https://etenders.london2012.com/locog/

2.             Click the “Register for London 2012 eTendering” link in
the top left

3.             Click the “Register Now” link

4.             Read the terms and conditions, agree and click “continue”

5.             Enter your correct business and user details; you can
enter more than one email address if necessary using a semi-colon to
separate the email addresses

6.             Note the username you chose and click “Save” when complete

7.             You will shortly receive an email with your unique
password (please keep this secure)



Email confirmation of registration

When you have registered your organisation on the eTendering website,
please email confirmation of this to ServicesTenders@london2012.com
including the email address, company name and contact name that you
have registered under.



Once you have signed up, you will be invited to participate in the ITT
when it goes live. You will receive an email from the system telling
you when the ITT is live. The ITT is scheduled to go live Wed 22nd
June.



Kind regards



Services Tenders



London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd

One Churchill Place

Canary Wharf

London E14 5LN



Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000

Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001

london2012.com





P Please consider the environment before printing this email



________________________________
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic
Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office
at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered
number 05267819

This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not
copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received
this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your
system and notify the sender immediately by return E-mail.

Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal
relations between us unless there is an express statement creating
such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.

Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure,
error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any
errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com

________________________________
